CatDescriptText: Mr. Humphrey Carsen, 1323 Locust Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 14, 1958, pg. 8 with question: �Do you think ministers should invest in business enterprises for profit, or become executives or directors of such concern?� answer reads: �No, because that would be wrong. You can�t mix too many things together.  If the mister is in the ministry, he should not be in business.  IN business, there�s a chance that sometimes he might have to come into contact with racketeers.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Humphrey Carsen, wearing hat, eyeglasses, moustache, and light colored short sleeved shirt, standing on Penn Avenue with pedestrians, across from the Stanley Theatre with marquee inscribed "Stanley Photo... Douglas with Adolph Menjou... Morris... and of Glory", Downtown
